Title:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 STIG SCAP Benchmark - NIWC Enhanced with Manual Questions
Description:This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DOD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.
Notice:Portions of this document were developed at Naval Information Warfare Center Atlantic by employees of the Federal Government in the course of their official duties. Pursuant to title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code this software is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain. The Government has no obligation hereunder to provide maintenance, support, updates, enhancements, or modifications. We would appreciate acknowledgement if the software is used. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.

Release Info:Enhanced Content 1.9.3 Date: 2023-05-09, based on Release: 1.9 Benchmark Date: 27 Apr 2023

Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    Automated Checks

    • V-230223 - RHEL 8 must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: to provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards. - Fail
    • V-230235 - RHEL 8 operating systems booted with a BIOS must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes. - Fail
    • V-230265 - RHEL 8 must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization. - Fail
    • V-230531 - The systemd Ctrl-Alt-Delete burst key sequence in RHEL 8 must be disabled. - Fail
    • V-244540 - RHEL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the system-auth file. - Fail
    • V-244541 - RHEL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the password-auth file. - Fail

    Manual Checks

    Results: Medium Severity (CAT II)

      Automated Checks

      • V-230232 - RHEL 8 must employ FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for all stored passwords. - Fail
      • V-230244 - RHEL 8 must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminated at the end of the session or after 10 minutes of inactivity, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements. - Fail
      • V-230266 - RHEL 8 must prevent the loading of a new kernel for later execution. - Fail
      • V-230280 - RHEL 8 must implement address space layout randomization (ASLR) to protect its memory from unauthorized code execution. - Fail

      • V-230337 - RHEL 8 must automatically lock an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period. - Fail

      • V-230343 - RHEL 8 must log user name information when unsuccessful logon attempts occur. - Fail
      • V-230345 - RHEL 8 must include root when automatically locking an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period. - Fail
      • V-230348 - RHEL 8 must enable a user session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures for command line sessions. - Fail
      • V-230349 - RHEL 8 must ensure session control is automatically started at shell initialization. - Fail
      • V-230357 - RHEL 8 must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one uppercase character be used. - Fail
      • V-230358 - RHEL 8 must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one lower-case character be used. - Fail
      • V-230359 - RHEL 8 must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one numeric character be used. - Fail
      • V-230360 - RHEL 8 must require the maximum number of repeating characters of the same character class be limited to four when passwords are changed. - Fail
      • V-230361 - RHEL 8 must require the maximum number of repeating characters be limited to three when passwords are changed. - Fail
      • V-230362 - RHEL 8 must require the change of at least four character classes when passwords are changed. - Fail
      • V-230363 - RHEL 8 must require the change of at least 8 characters when passwords are changed. - Fail
      • V-230364 - RHEL 8 passwords must have a 24 hours/1 day minimum password lifetime restriction in /etc/shadow. - Fail
      • V-230365 - RHEL 8 passwords for new users or password changes must have a 24 hours/1 day minimum password lifetime restriction in /etc/login.defs. - Fail
      • V-230366 - RHEL 8 user account passwords must have a 60-day maximum password lifetime restriction. - Fail
      • V-230367 - RHEL 8 user account passwords must be configured so that existing passwords are restricted to a 60-day maximum lifetime. - Fail
      • V-230368 - RHEL 8 must be configured in the password-auth file to prohibit password reuse for a minimum of five generations. - Fail
      • V-230369 - RHEL 8 passwords must have a minimum of 15 characters. - Fail
      • V-230370 - RHEL 8 passwords for new users must have a minimum of 15 characters. - Fail

      • V-230375 - All RHEL 8 passwords must contain at least one special character. - Fail
      • V-230377 - RHEL 8 must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords. - Fail
      • V-230378 - RHEL 8 must enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed logon attempt. - Fail

      • V-230412 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the su command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record. - Fail

      • V-230536 - RHEL 8 must not send Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects. - Fail

      Manual Checks

      Results: Low Severity (CAT III)

        Automated Checks

        • V-230269 - RHEL 8 must restrict access to the kernel message buffer. - Fail
        • V-230270 - RHEL 8 must prevent kernel profiling by unprivileged users. - Fail
        • V-230292 - RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for /var. - Fail
        • V-230293 - RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for /var/log. - Fail
        • V-230294 - RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for the system audit data path. - Fail
        • V-230346 - RHEL 8 must limit the number of concurrent sessions to ten for all accounts and/or account types. - Fail
        • V-230485 - RHEL 8 must disable the chrony daemon from acting as a server. - Fail
        • V-230486 - RHEL 8 must disable network management of the chrony daemon. - Fail
        • V-230494 - RHEL 8 must disable the asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) protocol. - Fail
        • V-230495 - RHEL 8 must disable the controller area network (CAN) protocol. - Fail
        • V-230496 - RHEL 8 must disable the stream control transmission protocol (SCTP). - Fail
        • V-230497 - RHEL 8 must disable the transparent inter-process communication (TIPC) protocol. - Fail
        • V-230498 - RHEL 8 must disable mounting of cramfs. - Fail
        • V-230499 - RHEL 8 must disable IEEE 1394 (FireWire) Support. - Fail

        Manual Checks

        Detailed Results: High Severity (CAT I)

          V-230223 - RHEL 8 must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: to provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230223r877398_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010020
          Identities:CCI-000068 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
          Description: Use of weak or untested encryption algorithms undermines the purposes of using encryption to protect data. The operating system must implement cryptographic modules adhering to the higher standards approved by the Federal Government since this provides assurance they have been tested and validated.

          RHEL 8 utilizes GRUB 2 as the default bootloader. Note that GRUB 2 command-line parameters are defined in the "kernelopts" variable of the /boot/grub2/grubenv file for all kernel boot entries. The command "fips-mode-setup" modifies the "kernelopts" variable, which in turn updates all kernel boot entries.

          The fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel command line during system installation so that key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place. Users must also ensure the system has plenty of entropy during the installation process by moving the mouse around, or if no mouse is available, ensuring that many keystrokes are typed. The recommended amount of keystrokes is 256 and more. Less than 256 keystrokes may generate a non-unique key.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000033-GPOS-00014, SRG-OS-000125-GPOS-00065, SRG-OS-000396-GPOS-00176, SRG-OS-000423-GPOS-00187, SRG-OS-000478-GPOS-00223 false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement DoD-approved encryption by following the steps below:

          To enable strict FIPS compliance, the fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel boot parameters during system installation so key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place.

          Enable FIPS mode after installation (not strict FIPS compliant) with the following command:

          $ sudo fips-mode-setup --enable

          Reboot the system for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:high
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:101
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010020 - RHEL 8 must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: to provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.
          Description:Use of weak or untested encryption algorithms undermines the purposes of using encryption to protect data. The operating system must implement cryptographic modules adhering to the higher standards approved by the Federal Government since this provides assurance they have been tested and validated.

          RHEL 8 utilizes GRUB 2 as the default bootloader. Note that GRUB 2 command-line parameters are defined in the "kernelopts" variable of the /boot/grub2/grubenv file for all kernel boot entries. The command "fips-mode-setup" modifies the "kernelopts" variable, which in turn updates all kernel boot entries.

          The fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel command line during system installation so that key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place. Users must also ensure the system has plenty of entropy during the installation process by moving the mouse around, or if no mouse is available, ensuring that many keystrokes are typed. The recommended amount of keystrokes is 256 and more. Less than 256 keystrokes may generate a non-unique key.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (fips_enabled == 1)
            • false (/boot/grub2/grubenv:kernelopts contains fips=1)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:10100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:fips_enabled == 1
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:10100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^(\d+)$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:10100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]
          • filepath equals '/proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled'
          • path equals '/proc/sys/crypto'
          • filename equals 'fips_enabled'
          • pattern equals '^(\d+)$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals '0'
          • line equals '0'
          • subexpression equals '0'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          subexpression
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:10101 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/boot/grub2/grubenv:kernelopts contains fips=1
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:10101 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grubenv'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*kernelopts=[^#]*fips=(\d+)\b'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:10100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230235 - RHEL 8 operating systems booted with a BIOS must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230235r743925_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010150
          Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
          Description: If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for RHEL 8 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or make modifications to the boot menu. false
          Fix Text:Configure the system to require a grub bootloader password for the grub superusers account with the grub2-setpassword command, which creates/overwrites the /boot/grub2/user.cfg file.

          Generate an encrypted grub2 password for the grub superusers account with the following command:

          $ sudo grub2-setpassword
          Enter password:
          Confirm password:
          Severity:high
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:107
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010150 - RHEL 8 operating systems booted with a BIOS must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.
          Description:If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for RHEL 8 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or make modifications to the boot menu.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (/boot/grub2/grub.cfg:superusers exists and has a name.)
              • false (/boot/grub2/user.cfg:GRUB2_PASSWORD exists and has a PBKDF2/SHA512 password assigned.)
            • false (/boot/grub2/grub.cfg exists.) (negated)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:10700 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:/boot/grub2/grub.cfg:superusers exists and has a name.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:10700 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*set\s+superusers\s*=\s*"(\w+)"\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:10700 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^\S+$'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:10701 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/boot/grub2/user.cfg:GRUB2_PASSWORD exists and has a PBKDF2/SHA512 password assigned.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:10701 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/user.cfg'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*GRUB2_PASSWORD=(\S+)\b'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:10701 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^grub.pbkdf2.sha512'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:10702 (file_test)
          Result:true
          Title:/boot/grub2/grub.cfg exists.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:10702 (file_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • filepath equals '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
          • path equals '/boot/grub2'
          • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
          • type equals 'regular'
          • group_id equals '0'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • a_time equals '1694483732'
          • c_time equals '1694481668'
          • m_time equals '1694481668'
          • size equals '6510'
          • suid equals '0'
          • sgid equals '0'
          • sticky equals '0'
          • uread equals '1'
          • uwrite equals '1'
          • uexec equals '0'
          • gread equals '0'
          • gwrite equals '0'
          • gexec equals '0'
          • oread equals '0'
          • owrite equals '0'
          • oexec equals '0'

          V-230265 - RHEL 8 must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230265r877463_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010371
          Identities:CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
          Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

          Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

          Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved CA. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to remove all software components after updated versions have been installed.

          Set the "localpkg_gpgcheck" option to "True" in the "/etc/dnf/dnf.conf" file:

          localpkg_gpgcheck=True
          Severity:high
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:131
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010371 - RHEL 8 must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.
          Description:Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

          Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

          Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved CA.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/dnf/dnf.conf:[main]localpkg_gpgcheck is set to true.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:13100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/dnf/dnf.conf:[main]localpkg_gpgcheck is set to true.
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:13100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dnf/dnf.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[main\]\s*\n(?:[^[]*\n)*\s*localpkg_gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\w+)\b'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:13100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(True|1|yes)$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230531 - The systemd Ctrl-Alt-Delete burst key sequence in RHEL 8 must be disabled.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230531r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-040172
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: A locally logged-on user who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete when at the console can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of availability of systems due to unintentional reboot. In a graphical user environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken. false
          Fix Text:Configure the system to disable the CtrlAltDelBurstAction by added or modifying the following line in the "/etc/systemd/system.conf" configuration file:

          CtrlAltDelBurstAction=none

          Reload the daemon for this change to take effect.

          $ sudo systemctl daemon-reload
          Severity:high
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:345
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-040172 - The systemd Ctrl-Alt-Delete burst key sequence in RHEL 8 must be disabled.
          Description:A locally logged-on user who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete when at the console can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of availability of systems due to unintentional reboot. In a graphical user environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (fips_enabled == 1)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:34500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:fips_enabled == 1
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:34500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/systemd/system.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*CtrlAltDelBurstAction\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:34500 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'none'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-244540 - RHEL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the system-auth file.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-244540r743869_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-020331
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments. false
          Fix Text:Remove any instances of the "nullok" option in the "/etc/pam.d/system-auth" file to prevent logons with empty passwords.

          Note: Manual changes to the listed file may be overwritten by the "authselect" program.
          Severity:high
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:463
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-020331 - RHEL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the system-auth file.
          Description:If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments.
          Class:compliance

          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          V-230232 - RHEL 8 must employ FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for all stored passwords.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230232r877397_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010120
          Identities:CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
          Description: The system must use a strong hashing algorithm to store the password.

          Passwords need to be protected at all times, and encryption is the standard method for protecting passwords. If passwords are not encrypted, they can be plainly read (i.e., clear text) and easily compromised. false
          Fix Text:Lock all interactive user accounts not using SHA-512 hashing until the passwords can be regenerated with SHA-512.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:104
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010120 - RHEL 8 must employ FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for all stored passwords.
          Description:The system must use a strong hashing algorithm to store the password.

          Passwords need to be protected at all times, and encryption is the standard method for protecting passwords. If passwords are not encrypted, they can be plainly read (i.e., clear text) and easily compromised.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (No active password hash in /etc/shadow has a prefix other than '$6'.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:10400 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:No active password hash in /etc/shadow has a prefix other than '$6'.
          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:10401 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          Exclude Items If:
          • subexpression matches the pattern '^[!*]'
          Exclude Items If:
          • subexpression matches the pattern '^[$][6]'
          Collected Item/State Result:

          • path equals '/etc'
          • filename equals 'shadow'
          • pattern equals '^[^:]+:([^:]*):'

          • text equals 'toast:$5$FS8s0hTWUqciRHxF$Yblb0zKNqtpPputpdQrWoB53luoGxZs3awnv5BKplp0:'
          • line equals 'toast:$5$FS8s0hTWUqciRHxF$Yblb0zKNqtpPputpdQrWoB53luoGxZs3awnv5BKplp0:'
          • subexpression equals '$5$FS8s0hTWUqciRHxF$Yblb0zKNqtpPputpdQrWoB53luoGxZs3awnv5BKplp0'

          • path equals '/etc'

          • line equals 'root:$5$FS8s0hTWUqciRHxF$Yblb0zKNqtpPputpdQrWoB53luoGxZs3awnv5BKplp0:'
          • subexpression equals '$5$FS8s0hTWUqciRHxF$Yblb0zKNqtpPputpdQrWoB53luoGxZs3awnv5BKplp0'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230244 - RHEL 8 must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminated at the end of the session or after 10 minutes of inactivity, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230244r858697_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010200
          Identities:CCI-001133 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-10)
          Description: Terminating an idle SSH session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle SSH session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

          Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

          RHEL 8 utilizes /etc/ssh/sshd_config for configurations of OpenSSH. Within the sshd_config the product of the values of "ClientAliveInterval" and "ClientAliveCountMax" are used to establish the inactivity threshold. The "ClientAliveInterval" is a timeout interval in seconds after which if no data has been received from the client, sshd will send a message through the encrypted channel to request a response from the client. The "ClientAliveCountMax" is the number of client alive messages that may be sent without sshd receiving any messages back from the client. If this threshold is met, sshd will disconnect the client. For more information on these settings and others, refer to the sshd_config man pages.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072, SRG-OS-000126-GPOS-00066, SRG-OS-000279-GPOS-00109 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to automatically terminate all network connections associated with SSH traffic at the end of a session or after 10 minutes of inactivity.

          Modify or append the following lines in the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file:

          ClientAliveCountMax 1

          In order for the changes to take effect, the SSH daemon must be restarted.

          $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8os:def:230244
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010200 - RHEL 8 must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminated at the end of the session or after 10 minutes of inactivity, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.
          Description:Terminating an idle SSH session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle SSH session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

          Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

          RHEL 8 utilizes /etc/ssh/sshd_config for configurations of OpenSSH. Within the sshd_config the product of the values of "ClientAliveInterval" and "ClientAliveCountMax" are used to establish the inactivity threshold. The "ClientAliveInterval" is a timeout interval in seconds after which if no data has been received from the client, sshd will send a message through the encrypted channel to request a response from the client. The "ClientAliveCountMax" is the number of client alive messages that may be sent without sshd receiving any messages back from the client. If this threshold is met, sshd will disconnect the client. For more information on these settings and others, refer to the sshd_config man pages.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072, SRG-OS-000126-GPOS-00066, SRG-OS-000279-GPOS-00109
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:ClientAliveCountMax = 1)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:tst:23024400 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:ClientAliveCountMax = 1
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:obj:23024400 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)ClientAliveCountMax(?-i)\s+"?(\d+)"?\s*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:ste:20000003 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230266 - RHEL 8 must prevent the loading of a new kernel for later execution.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230266r877463_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010372
          Identities:CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
          Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

          Disabling kexec_load prevents an unsigned kernel image (that could be a windows kernel or modified vulnerable kernel) from being loaded. Kexec can be used subvert the entire secureboot process and should be avoided at all costs especially since it can load unsigned kernel images.

          The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
          /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /etc/sysctl.conf false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable kernel image loading.

          Add or edit the following line in a system configuration file, in the "/etc/sysctl.d/" directory:

          kernel.kexec_load_disabled = 1

          Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
          /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /etc/sysctl.conf
          /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

          Load settings from all system configuration files with the following command:

          $ sudo sysctl --system
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:132
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010372 - RHEL 8 must prevent the loading of a new kernel for later execution.
          Description:Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

          Disabling kexec_load prevents an unsigned kernel image (that could be a windows kernel or modified vulnerable kernel) from being loaded. Kexec can be used subvert the entire secureboot process and should be avoided at all costs especially since it can load unsigned kernel images.

          The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
          /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /etc/sysctl.conf
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel.kexec_load_disabled setting in kernel is set to 1)
            • false (kernel.kexec_load_disabled setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:13200 (sysctl_test)
          Result:false
          Title:kernel.kexec_load_disabled setting in kernel is set to 1
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:13200 (sysctl_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'kernel.kexec_load_disabled'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:13200 (sysctl_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]
          • name equals 'kernel.kexec_load_disabled'
          • value equals '0'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          value
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:13201 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:kernel.kexec_load_disabled setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:13203 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:13201 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230280 - RHEL 8 must implement address space layout randomization (ASLR) to protect its memory from unauthorized code execution.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230280r858767_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010430
          Identities:CCI-002824 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-16; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-16)
          Description: Some adversaries launch attacks with the intent of executing code in non-executable regions of memory or in memory locations that are prohibited. Security safeguards employed to protect memory include, for example, data execution prevention and address space layout randomization. Data execution prevention safeguards can be either hardware-enforced or software-enforced with hardware providing the greater strength of mechanism.

          Examples of attacks are buffer overflow attacks.

          The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
          /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /etc/sysctl.conf false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement virtual address space randomization.

          Add or edit the following line in a system configuration file, in the "/etc/sysctl.d/" directory:

          kernel.randomize_va_space=2

          Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
          /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /etc/sysctl.conf
          /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

          Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

          $ sudo sysctl --system
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:144
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010430 - RHEL 8 must implement address space layout randomization (ASLR) to protect its memory from unauthorized code execution.
          Description:Some adversaries launch attacks with the intent of executing code in non-executable regions of memory or in memory locations that are prohibited. Security safeguards employed to protect memory include, for example, data execution prevention and address space layout randomization. Data execution prevention safeguards can be either hardware-enforced or software-enforced with hardware providing the greater strength of mechanism.

          Examples of attacks are buffer overflow attacks.

          The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
          /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
          /etc/sysctl.conf
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (kernel.randomize_va_space is set to 2 in kernel)
            • false (kernel.randomize_va_space is set to 2 in the sysctl configuration files, and there are no conflicting settings in other files.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:14400 (sysctl_test)
          Result:true
          Title:kernel.randomize_va_space is set to 2 in kernel
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:14400 (sysctl_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'kernel.randomize_va_space'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:14400 (sysctl_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:14401 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:kernel.randomize_va_space is set to 2 in the sysctl configuration files, and there are no conflicting settings in other files.
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:14403 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:14401 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '2'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230288 - The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must perform strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230288r858701_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010500
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: If other users have access to modify user-specific SSH configuration files, they may be able to log on to the system as another user. false
          Fix Text:Configure SSH to perform strict mode checking of home directory configuration files. Uncomment the "StrictModes" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" and set the value to "yes":

          StrictModes yes

          The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

          $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:151
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010500 - The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must perform strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.
          Description:If other users have access to modify user-specific SSH configuration files, they may be able to log on to the system as another user.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:StrictModes == yes)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (The openssh package is version 7.6 or greater.)
              • true (The ssh daemon is running.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:15100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:StrictModes == yes
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:15100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)StrictModes(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:15100 (textfilecontent54_state)

          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(yes|"yes")$'

          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32401 (rpminfo_test)

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:9900 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'openssh'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:32401 (rpminfo_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', evr must be greater than or equal to '0:7.6p1-0'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32400 (process58_test)

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32400 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/usr/sbin/sshd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/usr/sbin/sshd -D -oCiphers=aes256-gcm@openssh.com,chacha20-poly1305@openssh.com,aes256-ctr,aes256-cbc,aes128-gcm@openssh.com,aes128-ctr,aes128-cbc -oMACs=hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha1-etm@openssh.com,umac-128-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-256,hmac-sha1,umac-128@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512 -oGSSAPIKexAlgorithms=gss-curve25519-sha256-,gss-nistp256-sha256-,gss-group14-sha256-,gss-group16-sha512-,gss-gex-sha1-,gss-group14-sha1- -oKexAlgorithms=curve25519-sha256,curve25519-sha256@libssh.org,ecdh-sha2-nistp256,ecdh-sha2-nistp384,ecdh-sha2-nistp521,diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256,diffie-hellman-group14-sha256,diffie-hellman-group16-sha512,diffie-hellman-group18-sha512,diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1,diffie-hellman-group14-sha1 -oHostKeyAlgorithms=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-ed25519,ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-256-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-512,rsa-sha2-512-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-rsa,ssh-rsa-cert-v01@openssh.com -oPubkeyAcceptedKeyTypes=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-ed25519,ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-256-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-512,rsa-sha2-512-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-rsa,ssh-rsa-cert-v01@openssh.com -oCASignatureAlgorithms=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ssh-ed25519,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-512,ssh-rsa'

          • pid equals '1107'

          V-230290 - The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must not allow authentication using known hostâ€™s authentication.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230290r858705_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010520
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
          Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow authentication using known hostâ€™s authentication.

          Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "yes":

          IgnoreUserKnownHosts yes

          The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

          $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:153
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010520 - The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must not allow authentication using known hosts authentication.
          Description:Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:IgnoreUserKnownHosts == yes)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (The openssh package is version 7.6 or greater.)

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BROADCAST'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_RAW'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_LOCK'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_OWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_MODULE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RAWIO'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_CHROOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PTRACE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PACCT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_BOOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_NICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RESOURCE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TIME'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TTY_CONFIG'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_WRITE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_READ'
          • selinux_domain_label equals 'sshd_t'
          • session_id equals '1107'

          V-230291 - The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must not allow Kerberos authentication, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230291r858707_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010521
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Configuring these settings for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will not use unused methods of authentication, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
          Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow Kerberos authentication.

          Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "no":

          KerberosAuthentication no

          The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

          $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:154
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010521 - The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must not allow Kerberos authentication, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.
          Description:Configuring these settings for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will not use Kerberos authentication, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:KerberosAuthentication == no)
            • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
              • true (The openssh package is installed.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:15400 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:KerberosAuthentication == no
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:15400 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)KerberosAuthentication(?-i)\s+(\w+)\s*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:15400 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'no'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:9900 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:The openssh package is installed.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:9900 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'openssh'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'openssh'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '17.el8'
          • version equals '8.0p1'
          • evr equals '0:8.0p1-17.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'openssh-(none):8.0p1-17.el8.x86_64'

          V-230295 - A separate RHEL 8 filesystem must be used for the /tmp directory.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230295r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010543
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing. false
          Fix Text:Migrate the "/tmp" directory onto a separate file system/partition.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:158
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010543 - A separate RHEL 8 filesystem must be used for the /tmp directory.
          Description:The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (There is a separate file system for /tmp.)
            • false (There is a separate file system configured for /tmp.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:15800 (partition_test)
          Result:false
          Title:There is a separate file system for /tmp.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:15800 (partition_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • mount_point must be equal to '/tmp'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • mount_point does not exist
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:15801 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:There is a separate file system configured for /tmp.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:15801 (textfilecontent54_object)

          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/fstab'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[^# \t]+\s+/tmp\s+'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230296 - RHEL 8 must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230296r858711_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010550
          Identities:CCI-000770 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-2 (5) (b); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-2 (5).2 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (5))
          Description: Even though the communications channel may be encrypted, an additional layer of security is gained by extending the policy of not logging on directly as root. In addition, logging on with a user-specific account provides individual accountability of actions performed on the system. false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to stop users from logging on remotely as the "root" user via SSH.

          Edit the appropriate "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for the "PermitRootLogin" keyword and set its value to "no":

          PermitRootLogin no

          The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

          $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:159
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010550 - RHEL 8 must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH.
          Description:Even though the communications channel may be encrypted, an additional layer of security is gained by extending the policy of not logging on directly as root. In addition, logging on with a user-specific account provides individual accountability of actions performed on the system.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PermitRootLogin == no)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (The openssh package is version 7.6 or greater.)
              • true (The ssh daemon is running.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:15900 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PermitRootLogin == no
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:15900 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)PermitRootLogin(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:15900 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|"no")$'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]
          • filepath equals '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
          • path equals '/etc/ssh'
          • filename equals 'sshd_config'
          • pattern equals '^\s*(?i)PermitRootLogin(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'PermitRootLogin yes
            #StrictModes yes'
          • line equals 'PermitRootLogin yes
            #StrictModes yes'
          • subexpression equals 'yes'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          subexpression
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32401 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:The openssh package is version 7.6 or greater.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:9900 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'openssh'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:32401 (rpminfo_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', evr must be greater than or equal to '0:7.6p1-0'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32400 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:The ssh daemon is running.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32400 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/usr/sbin/sshd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/usr/sbin/sshd -D -oCiphers=aes256-gcm@openssh.com,chacha20-poly1305@openssh.com,aes256-ctr,aes256-cbc,aes128-gcm@openssh.com,aes128-ctr,aes128-cbc -oMACs=hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha1-etm@openssh.com,umac-128-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-256,hmac-sha1,umac-128@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512 -oGSSAPIKexAlgorithms=gss-curve25519-sha256-,gss-nistp256-sha256-,gss-group14-sha256-,gss-group16-sha512-,gss-gex-sha1-,gss-group14-sha1- -oKexAlgorithms=curve25519-sha256,curve25519-sha256@libssh.org,ecdh-sha2-nistp256,ecdh-sha2-nistp384,ecdh-sha2-nistp521,diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256,diffie-hellman-group14-sha256,diffie-hellman-group16-sha512,diffie-hellman-group18-sha512,diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1,diffie-hellman-group14-sha1 -oHostKeyAlgorithms=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-ed25519,ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-256-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-512,rsa-sha2-512-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-rsa,ssh-rsa-cert-v01@openssh.com -oPubkeyAcceptedKeyTypes=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-ed25519,ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-256-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-512,rsa-sha2-512-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-rsa,ssh-rsa-cert-v01@openssh.com -oCASignatureAlgorithms=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ssh-ed25519,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-512,ssh-rsa'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '1107'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '20'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:47'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
