          V-230373 - RHEL 8 account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) must be disabled after 35 days of inactivity.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230373r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-020260
          Identities:CCI-000795 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-4 e; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-4.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-4 e)
          Description: Inactive identifiers pose a risk to systems and applications because attackers may exploit an inactive identifier and potentially obtain undetected access to the system. Owners of inactive accounts will not notice if unauthorized access to their user account has been obtained.

          RHEL 8 needs to track periods of inactivity and disable application identifiers after 35 days of inactivity. false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to disable account identifiers after 35 days of inactivity after the password expiration.

          Run the following command to change the configuration for useradd:

          $ sudo useradd -D -f 35

          DoD recommendation is 35 days, but a lower value is acceptable. The value "-1" will disable this feature, and "0" will disable the account immediately after the password expires.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:211
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-020260 - RHEL 8 account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) must be disabled after 35 days of inactivity.
          Description:Inactive identifiers pose a risk to systems and applications because attackers may exploit an inactive identifier and potentially obtain undetected access to the system. Owners of inactive accounts will not notice if unauthorized access to their user account has been obtained.

          RHEL 8 needs to track periods of inactivity and disable application identifiers after 35 days of inactivity.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/default/useradd: INACTIVE is set to 35 or less, but not -1)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:21100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/default/useradd: INACTIVE is set to 35 or less, but not -1
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:21100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/default/useradd'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*INACTIVE\s*=\s*(-?\d+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:21100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '0'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:21101 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be less than or equal to '35'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]
          • filepath equals '/etc/default/useradd'
          • path equals '/etc/default'
          • filename equals 'useradd'
          • pattern equals '(?i)^\s*INACTIVE\s*=\s*(-?\d+)\s*$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'INACTIVE=-1'
          • line equals 'INACTIVE=-1'
          • subexpression equals '-1'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          subexpression

          V-230375 - All RHEL 8 passwords must contain at least one special character.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230375r858787_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-020280
          Identities:CCI-001619 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
          Description: Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

          Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised.

          RHEL 8 utilizes "pwquality" as a mechanism to enforce password complexity. Note that to require special characters without degrading the "minlen" value, the credit value must be expressed as a negative number in "/etc/security/pwquality.conf". false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one special character be used by setting the "ocredit" option.

          Add the following line to /etc/security/pwquality.conf (or modify the line to have the required value):

          ocredit = -1

          Remove any configurations that conflict with the above value.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:212
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-020280 - All RHEL 8 passwords must contain at least one special character.
          Description:Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

          Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised.

          RHEL 8 utilizes "pwquality" as a mechanism to enforce password complexity. Note that to require special characters without degrading the "minlen" value, the credit value must be expressed as a negative number in "/etc/security/pwquality.conf".
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (passwords must contain at least one special character)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:21200 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:passwords must contain at least one special character
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:21200 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/security/pwquality.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*ocredit\s*=\s*(-?\d*)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:19700 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be less than '0'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230377 - RHEL 8 must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230377r858789_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-020300
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: If RHEL 8 allows the user to select passwords based on dictionary words, this increases the chances of password compromise by increasing the opportunity for successful guesses, and brute-force attacks. false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.

          Add or update the following line in the "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" file or a configuration file in the /etc/pwquality.conf.d/ directory to contain the "dictcheck" parameter:

          dictcheck=1

          Remove any configurations that conflict with the above value.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:214
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-021400 - RHEL 8 must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.
          Description:If RHEL 8 allows the user to select passwords based on dictionary words, this increases the chances of password compromise by increasing the opportunity for successful guesses, and brute-force attacks.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (passwords must not be dictionary words)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:21400 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:passwords must not be dictionary words
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:21402 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:9801 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230378 - RHEL 8 must enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed logon attempt.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230378r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-020310
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Configuring the operating system to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists verifies compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across the DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

          Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are those parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt.

          Modify the "/etc/login.defs" file to set the "FAIL_DELAY" parameter to "4" or greater:

          FAIL_DELAY 4
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921

          Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are those parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections.

            • false (/etc/login.defs: FAIL_DELAY = 4 or greater)

          V-230382 - RHEL 8 must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230382r858717_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-020350
          Identities:CCI-000052 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-9)
          Description: Providing users with feedback on when account accesses via SSH last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use. false
          Fix Text:Configure SSH to provide users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred by setting the required configuration options in "/etc/pam.d/sshd" or in the "sshd_config" file used by the system ("/etc/ssh/sshd_config" will be used in the example) (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor).

          Modify the "PrintLastLog" line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" to match the following:

          PrintLastLog yes

          The SSH service must be restarted for changes to "sshd_config" to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:218
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-020350 - RHEL 8 must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon.
          Description:Providing users with feedback on when account accesses via SSH last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PrintLastLog == yes)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (The openssh package is version 7.6 or greater.)
              • true (The ssh daemon is running.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:21800 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PrintLastLog == yes
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:21800 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)PrintLastLog(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:21800 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(yes|"yes")$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32401 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:The openssh package is version 7.6 or greater.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:9900 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'openssh'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:32401 (rpminfo_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', evr must be greater than or equal to '0:7.6p1-0'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32400 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:The ssh daemon is running.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32400 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/usr/sbin/sshd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/usr/sbin/sshd -D -oCiphers=aes256-gcm@openssh.com,chacha20-poly1305@openssh.com,aes256-ctr,aes256-cbc,aes128-gcm@openssh.com,aes128-ctr,aes128-cbc -oMACs=hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha1-etm@openssh.com,umac-128-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-256,hmac-sha1,umac-128@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512 -oGSSAPIKexAlgorithms=gss-curve25519-sha256-,gss-nistp256-sha256-,gss-group14-sha256-,gss-group16-sha512-,gss-gex-sha1-,gss-group14-sha1- -oKexAlgorithms=curve25519-sha256,curve25519-sha256@libssh.org,ecdh-sha2-nistp256,ecdh-sha2-nistp384,ecdh-sha2-nistp521,diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256,diffie-hellman-group14-sha256,diffie-hellman-group16-sha512,diffie-hellman-group18-sha512,diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1,diffie-hellman-group14-sha1 -oHostKeyAlgorithms=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-ed25519,ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-256-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-512,rsa-sha2-512-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-rsa,ssh-rsa-cert-v01@openssh.com -oPubkeyAcceptedKeyTypes=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-ed25519,ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-256-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-512,rsa-sha2-512-cert-v01@openssh.com,ssh-rsa,ssh-rsa-cert-v01@openssh.com -oCASignatureAlgorithms=ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ssh-ed25519,rsa-sha2-256,rsa-sha2-512,ssh-rsa'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '1107'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '20'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:47'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • loginuid equals '4294967295'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_CHOWN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FOWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BROADCAST'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_RAW'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_LOCK'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_OWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_MODULE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RAWIO'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_CHROOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PTRACE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PACCT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_BOOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_NICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RESOURCE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TIME'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TTY_CONFIG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MKNOD'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LEASE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_WRITE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETFCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYSLOG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_WAKE_ALARM'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_READ'
          • selinux_domain_label equals 'sshd_t'
          • session_id equals '1107'

          V-230383 - RHEL 8 must define default permissions for all authenticated users in such a way that the user can only read and modify their own files.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230383r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-020351
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Setting the most restrictive default permissions ensures that when new accounts are created, they do not have unnecessary access. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to define default permissions for all authenticated users in such a way that the user can only read and modify their own files.

          Add or edit the line for the "UMASK" parameter in "/etc/login.defs" file to "077":

          UMASK 077
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:219
          Result:false

          Description:Setting the most restrictive default permissions ensures that when new accounts are created, they do not have unnecessary access.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/login.defs:UMASK == 077)
          Tests:

          Result:false

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:21900 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*UMASK\s+([^#\s]+)'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '077'

          subexpression

          V-230386 - The RHEL 8 audit system must be configured to audit the execution of privileged functions and prevent all software from executing at higher privilege levels than users executing the software.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230386r854037_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030000
          Identities:CCI-002233 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (8); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (8))
          Description: Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have significant adverse impacts on organizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000326-GPOS-00126, SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to audit the execution of the "execve" system call.

          Add or update the following file system rules to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F euid=0 -k execpriv
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F euid=0 -k execpriv

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F egid=0 -k execpriv
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F egid=0 -k execpriv

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:220
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030000 - The RHEL 8 audit system must be configured to audit the execution of privileged functions and prevent all software from executing at higher privilege levels than users executing the software.
          Description:Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have significant adverse impacts on organizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of execve syscall comparing uids)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of execve syscall comparing uids)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of execve syscall comparing gids)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of execve syscall comparing gids)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:22000 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit 32-bit invocations of execve syscall comparing uids
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:22000 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:

          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b32\s+-S\s+execve\s+-C\s+uid!=euid\s+-F\s+euid=0\s*((\s+-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+\s*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:22001 (textfilecontent54_test)

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:22001 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b64\s+-S\s+execve\s+-C\s+uid!=euid\s+-F\s+euid=0\s*((\s+-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+\s*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:22002 (textfilecontent54_test)

          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:22003 (textfilecontent54_test)

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.

          V-230390 - The RHEL 8 System must take appropriate action when an audit processing failure occurs.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230390r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030040
          Identities:CCI-000140 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-5 b; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-5.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-5 b)
          Description: It is critical for the appropriate personnel to be aware if a system is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required. Without this notification, the security personnel may be unaware of an impending failure of the audit capability, and system operation may be adversely affected.

          Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded.

          This requirement applies to each audit data storage repository (i.e., distinct information system component where audit records are stored), the centralized audit storage capacity of organizations (i.e., all audit data storage repositories combined), or both. false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to shut down by default upon audit failure (unless availability is an overriding concern).

          Add or update the following line (depending on configuration "disk_error_action" can be set to "SYSLOG" or "SINGLE" depending on configuration) in "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" file:

          disk_error_action = HALT

          If availability has been determined to be more important, and this decision is documented with the ISSO, configure the operating system to notify system administration staff and ISSO staff in the event of an audit processing failure by setting the "disk_error_action" to "SYSLOG".
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:223
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030040 - The RHEL 8 System must take appropriate action when an audit processing failure occurs.
          Description:It is critical for the appropriate personnel to be aware if a system is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required. Without this notification, the security personnel may be unaware of an impending failure of the audit capability, and system operation may be adversely affected.

          Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded.

          This requirement applies to each audit data storage repository (i.e., distinct information system component where audit records are stored), the centralized audit storage capacity of organizations (i.e., all audit data storage repositories combined), or both.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf: disk_error_action = SYSLOG, SINGLE, or HALT)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:22300 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf: disk_error_action = SYSLOG, SINGLE, or HALT
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:22300 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*disk_error_action\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22300 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^syslog$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22301 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^single$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22302 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^halt$'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]
          • filepath equals '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • path equals '/etc/audit'
          • filename equals 'auditd.conf'
          • pattern equals '(?i)^\s*disk_error_action\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'disk_error_action = SUSPEND'
          • line equals 'disk_error_action = SUSPEND'
          • subexpression equals 'SUSPEND'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          subexpression

          V-230392 - The RHEL 8 audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230392r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030060
          Identities:CCI-000140 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-5 b; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-5.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-5 b)
          Description: It is critical that when RHEL 8 is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required, it takes action to mitigate the failure. Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors; failures in the audit capturing mechanisms; and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded. Responses to audit failure depend upon the nature of the failure mode.

          When availability is an overriding concern, other approved actions in response to an audit failure are as follows:

          1) If the failure was caused by the lack of audit record storage capacity, RHEL 8 must continue generating audit records if possible (automatically restarting the audit service if necessary) and overwriting the oldest audit records in a first-in-first-out manner.

          2) If audit records are sent to a centralized collection server and communication with this server is lost or the server fails, RHEL 8 must queue audit records locally until communication is restored or until the audit records are retrieved manually. Upon restoration of the connection to the centralized collection server, action should be taken to synchronize the local audit data with the collection server. false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to shut down by default upon audit failure (unless availability is an overriding concern).

          Add or update the following line (depending on configuration "disk_full_action" can be set to "SYSLOG" or "SINGLE" depending on configuration) in "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" file:

          disk_full_action = HALT

          If availability has been determined to be more important, and this decision is documented with the ISSO, configure the operating system to notify system administration staff and ISSO staff in the event of an audit processing failure by setting the "disk_full_action" to "SYSLOG".
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:225
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030060 - The RHEL 8 audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.
          Description:It is critical that when RHEL 8 is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required, it takes action to mitigate the failure. Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors; failures in the audit capturing mechanisms; and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded. Responses to audit failure depend upon the nature of the failure mode.

          When availability is an overriding concern, other approved actions in response to an audit failure are as follows:

          1) If the failure was caused by the lack of audit record storage capacity, RHEL 8 must continue generating audit records if possible (automatically restarting the audit service if necessary) and overwriting the oldest audit records in a first-in-first-out manner.

          2) If audit records are sent to a centralized collection server and communication with this server is lost or the server fails, RHEL 8 must queue audit records locally until communication is restored or until the audit records are retrieved manually. Upon restoration of the connection to the centralized collection server, action should be taken to synchronize the local audit data with the collection server.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf: disk_full_action = SYSLOG, SINGLE, or HALT)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:22500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf: disk_full_action = SYSLOG, SINGLE, or HALT
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:22500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*disk_full_action\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22300 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^syslog$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22301 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^single$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22302 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^halt$'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]
          • filepath equals '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • path equals '/etc/audit'
          • filename equals 'auditd.conf'
          • pattern equals '(?i)^\s*disk_full_action\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'disk_full_action = SUSPEND'
          • line equals 'disk_full_action = SUSPEND'
          • subexpression equals 'SUSPEND'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          subexpression

          V-230394 - RHEL 8 must label all off-loaded audit logs before sending them to the central log server.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230394r877390_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030062
          Identities:CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
          Description: Without establishing what type of events occurred, the source of events, where events occurred, and the outcome of events, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

          Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.

          Enriched logging is needed to determine who, what, and when events occur on a system. Without this, determining root cause of an event will be much more difficult.

          When audit logs are not labeled before they are sent to a central log server, the audit data will not be able to be analyzed and tied back to the correct system. false
          Fix Text:Edit the /etc/audit/auditd.conf file and add or update the "name_format" option:

          name_format = hostname

          The audit daemon must be restarted for changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:227
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030062 - RHEL 8 must label all off-loaded audit logs before sending them to the central log server.
          Description:Without establishing what type of events occurred, the source of events, where events occurred, and the outcome of events, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

          Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.

          Enriched logging is needed to determine who, what, and when events occur on a system. Without this, determining root cause of an event will be much more difficult.

          When audit logs are not labeled before they are sent to a central log server, the audit data will not be able to be analyzed and tied back to the correct system.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf: name_format = hostname, fqd or numeric)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:22700 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf: name_format = hostname, fqd or numeric
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:22700 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*name_format\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22700 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^hostname$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22701 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^fqd$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:ste:22702 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^numeric$'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]
          • filepath equals '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • path equals '/etc/audit'
          • filename equals 'auditd.conf'
          • pattern equals '(?i)^\s*name_format\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'name_format = NONE
            ##name = mydomain'
          • line equals 'name_format = NONE
            ##name = mydomain'
          • subexpression equals 'NONE'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          subexpression

          V-230402 - RHEL 8 audit system must protect auditing rules from unauthorized change.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230402r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030121
          Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
          Description: Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

          Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit RHEL 8 system activity.

          In immutable mode, unauthorized users cannot execute changes to the audit system to potentially hide malicious activity and then put the audit rules back. A system reboot would be noticeable and a system administrator could then investigate the unauthorized changes.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to set the audit rules to be immutable by adding the following line to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules"

          -e 2

          Note: Once set, the system must be rebooted for auditing to be changed. It is recommended to add this option as the last step in securing the system.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:235
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030121 - RHEL 8 audit system must protect auditing rules from unauthorized change.
          Description:Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

          Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit RHEL 8 system activity.

          In immutable mode, unauthorized users cannot execute changes to the audit system to potentially hide malicious activity and then put the audit rules back. A system reboot would be noticeable and a system administrator could then investigate the unauthorized changes.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/audit.rules: -e 2 option is present and is the last line in the file)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:23500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/audit.rules: -e 2 option is present and is the last line in the file
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:23500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • multiline = false
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '\n[ \t]*-e[ \t]+2\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230403 - RHEL 8 audit system must protect logon UIDs from unauthorized change.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230403r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030122
          Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
          Description: Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

          Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit RHEL 8 system activity.

          In immutable mode, unauthorized users cannot execute changes to the audit system to potentially hide malicious activity and then put the audit rules back. A system reboot would be noticeable and a system administrator could then investigate the unauthorized changes.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to set the logon UIDs to be immutable by adding the following line to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules"

          --loginuid-immutable
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:236
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030122 - RHEL 8 audit system must protect logon UIDs from unauthorized change.
          Description:Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

          Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit RHEL 8 system activity.

          In immutable mode, unauthorized users cannot execute changes to the audit system to potentially hide malicious activity and then put the audit rules back. A system reboot would be noticeable and a system administrator could then investigate the unauthorized changes.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/audit.rules: --loginuid-immutable option is present)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:23600 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/audit.rules: --loginuid-immutable option is present
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:23600 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^--loginuid-immutable$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230404 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/shadow.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230404r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030130
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/shadow".

          Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/shadow -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:237
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030130 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/shadow.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit modifications to /etc/shadow)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:23700 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit modifications to /etc/shadow
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:23700 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-w\s+/etc/shadow(\s+-p\s*([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*))?(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\w+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/sbin/auditd'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '904'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '16'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:45'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • loginuid equals '4294967295'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_CHOWN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FOWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BROADCAST'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_RAW'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_LOCK'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_OWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RAWIO'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_CHROOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PTRACE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PACCT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_ADMIN'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_NICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RESOURCE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TIME'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TTY_CONFIG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MKNOD'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LEASE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_WRITE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETFCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYSLOG'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'

          • selinux_domain_label equals 'auditd_t'
          • session_id equals '904'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24400 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:package audit is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24400 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230405 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/security/opasswd.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230405r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030140
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/security/opasswd".

          Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/security/opasswd -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

          Weight:10.0

          V-230406 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/passwd.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230406r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030150
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false

          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:239
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030150 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/passwd.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

                • true (package audit is installed)

          Result:false
          Title:Audit modifications to /etc/passwd
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:23900 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-w\s+/etc/passwd(\s+-p\s*([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*))?(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\w+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/sbin/auditd'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '904'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '16'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:45'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • loginuid equals '4294967295'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_CHOWN'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FOWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BROADCAST'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_WRITE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETFCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYSLOG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_WAKE_ALARM'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_READ'
          • selinux_domain_label equals 'auditd_t'
          • session_id equals '904'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24400 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:package audit is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24400 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230407 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/gshadow.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230407r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030160
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/gshadow".

          Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/gshadow -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:240
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030160 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/gshadow.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit modifications to /etc/gshadow)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24000 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit modifications to /etc/gshadow
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24000 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-w\s+/etc/gshadow(\s+-p\s*([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*))?(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\w+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/sbin/auditd'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '904'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '16'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'

          V-230408 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/group.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230408r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030170
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, CCI-002884, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/group".

          Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/group -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:241
          Result:false

          V-230409 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/sudoers.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230409r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030171
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, CCI-002884, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false

          Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/sudoers -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0

          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYSLOG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_WAKE_ALARM'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_READ'
          • selinux_domain_label equals 'auditd_t'
          • session_id equals '904'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24400 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:package audit is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24400 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230410 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/sudoers.d/.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230410r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030172
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, CCI-002884, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/sudoers.d/".

          Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/sudoers.d/ -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:243
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030172 - RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/sudoers.d/.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit modifications to /etc/sudoers.d/)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:

          Result:false
          Title:Audit modifications to /etc/sudoers.d/
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24300 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-w\s+/etc/sudoers.d/(\s+-p\s*([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*))?(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\w+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
