          V-230412 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the su command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230412r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030190
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "su" command allows a user to run commands with a substitute user and group ID.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-0003, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "su" command occur by adding or updating the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/su -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:245
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030190 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the su command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "su" command allows a user to run commands with a substitute user and group ID.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/su)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/su
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/su\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230413 - The RHEL 8 audit system must be configured to audit any usage of the setxattr, fsetxattr, lsetxattr, removexattr, fremovexattr, and lremovexattr system calls.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230413r810463_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030200
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          "Setxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value.
          "Fsetxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value. This is used to set extended attributes on a file.
          "Lsetxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value. This is used to set extended attributes on a symbolic link.
          "Removexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes.
          "Fremovexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes. This is used for removal of extended attributes from a file.
          "Lremovexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes. This is used for removal of extended attributes from symbolic links.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210 false
          Fix Text:Configure RHEL 8 to audit the execution of the "setxattr", "fsetxattr", "lsetxattr", "removexattr", "fremovexattr", and "lremovexattr" system calls by adding or updating the following lines to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid=0 -k perm_mod
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid=0 -k perm_mod

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:246
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030200 - The RHEL 8 audit system must be configured to audit any usage of the setxattr, fsetxattr, lsetxattr, removexattr, fremovexattr and lremovexattr system calls.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). "Setxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value.
          "Fsetxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value. This is used to set extended attributes on a file.
          "Lsetxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value. This is used to set extended attributes on a symbolic link.
          "Removexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes.
          "Fremovexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes. This is used for removal of extended attributes from a file.
          "Lremovexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes. This is used for removal of extended attributes from symbolic links.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of setxattr syscall)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of setxattr syscall)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of setxattr syscall by root)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of setxattr syscall by root)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of fremovexattr syscall (auid>=1000))
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of fremovexattr syscall (auid>=1000))
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of fremovexattr syscall (auid=0))
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of fremovexattr syscall (auid=0))
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of fsetxattr syscall (auid>=1000))
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of fsetxattr syscall (auid>=1000))
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of fsetxattr syscall (auid=0))
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of fsetxattr syscall (auid=0))
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of lsetxattr syscall (auid>=1000))
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of lsetxattr syscall (auid>=1000))
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of lsetxattr syscall (auid=0))
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of lsetxattr syscall (auid=0))
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of removexattr syscall (auid>=1000))
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of removexattr syscall (auid>=1000))
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of removexattr syscall (auid=0))
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of removexattr syscall (auid=0))
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of lremovexattr syscall)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of lremovexattr syscall)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of lremovexattr syscall by root)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of lremovexattr syscall by root)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:25300 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit 32-bit invocations of setxattr syscall
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:25300 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b32\s+(?:.*(-S\s+setxattr\s+|(\s+|,)setxattr(\s+|,))).*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:25301 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit 64-bit invocations of setxattr syscall
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:25301 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b64\s+(?:.*(-S\s+setxattr\s+|(\s+|,)setxattr(\s+|,))).*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24400 (rpminfo_test)

          Title:package audit is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24400 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230418 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chage command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230418r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030250
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "chage" command is used to change or view user password expiry information.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful uses of the "chage" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chage -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-chage

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:251
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030250 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chage command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "chage" command is used to change or view user password expiry information.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/chage)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:25100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/chage
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:25100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/chage\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/sbin/auditd'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '904'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '16'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:45'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • loginuid equals '4294967295'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_CHOWN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FOWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BROADCAST'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_RAW'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_LOCK'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_OWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RAWIO'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_CHROOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PTRACE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PACCT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_BOOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_NICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RESOURCE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TIME'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TTY_CONFIG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MKNOD'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LEASE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_WRITE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETFCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYSLOG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_WAKE_ALARM'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_READ'
          • selinux_domain_label equals 'auditd_t'
          • session_id equals '904'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24400 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:package audit is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24400 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230419 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chcon command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230419r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030260
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "chcon" command is used to change file SELinux security context.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful use of the "chcon" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chcon -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1".           V-230421 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the ssh-agent in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230421r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030280
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "ssh-agent" is a program to hold private keys used for public key authentication.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful use of the "ssh-agent" by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/ssh-agent -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-ssh

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:254
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030280 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the ssh-agent in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          V-230422 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the passwd command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230422r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030290
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "passwd" command is used to change passwords for user accounts.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful uses of the "passwd" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/passwd -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-passwd

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:255
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030290 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the passwd command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "passwd" command is used to change passwords for user accounts.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/passwd)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:25500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/passwd
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:25500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/passwd\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/sbin/auditd'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '904'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '16'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:45'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • loginuid equals '4294967295'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_CHOWN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FOWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BROADCAST'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_RAW'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_LOCK'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_OWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RAWIO'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_CHROOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PTRACE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PACCT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_BOOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_NICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RESOURCE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TIME'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TTY_CONFIG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MKNOD'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LEASE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_WRITE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETFCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYSLOG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_WAKE_ALARM'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_READ'
          • selinux_domain_label equals 'auditd_t'
          • session_id equals '904'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24400 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:package audit is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24400 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230423 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the mount command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230423r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030300
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "mount" command is used to mount a filesystem.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful use of the "mount" command by adding or updating the following rules in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/mount -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:256
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030300 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the mount command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "mount" command is used to mount a filesystem.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/mount)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:25602 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/mount
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:25602 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/mount\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'

          [ not evaluated ]

          V-230424 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the umount command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230424r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030301
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "umount" command is used to unmount a filesystem.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful use of the "umount" command by adding or updating the following rules in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/umount -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0

          V-230425 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the mount syscall in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230425r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030302
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "mount" syscall is used to mount a filesystem.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful use of the "mount" syscall by adding or updating the following rules in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:258
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030302 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the mount syscall in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "mount" syscall is used to mount a filesystem.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of mount syscall)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of mount syscall)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:25800 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit 32-bit invocations of mount syscall
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:25800 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b32\s+(?:.*(-S\s+mount\s+|(\s+|,)mount(\s+|,))).*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:25801 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit 64-bit invocations of mount syscall
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:25801 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b64\s+(?:.*(-S\s+mount\s+|(\s+|,)mount(\s+|,))).*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/sbin/auditd'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '904'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '16'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:45'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • loginuid equals '4294967295'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_CHOWN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FOWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BROADCAST'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_RAW'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_LOCK'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_OWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RAWIO'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_CHROOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PTRACE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PACCT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_BOOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_NICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RESOURCE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TIME'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TTY_CONFIG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MKNOD'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LEASE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_WRITE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETFCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYSLOG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_WAKE_ALARM'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_READ'
          • selinux_domain_label equals 'auditd_t'
          • session_id equals '904'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24400 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:package audit is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24400 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230426 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the unix_update in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230426r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030310
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. "Unix_update" is a helper program for the "pam_unix" module that updates the password for a given user. It is not intended to be run directly from the command line and logs a security violation if done so.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful uses of the "unix_update" by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/unix_update -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:259
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030310 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of the unix_update in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.
          Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. "Unix_update" is a helper program for the "pam_unix" module that updates the password for a given user. It is not intended to be run directly from the command line and logs a security violation if done so.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/unix_update)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:25900 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/unix_update
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:25900 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/sbin/unix_update\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/sbin/auditd'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '904'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '16'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:45'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • loginuid equals '4294967295'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_CHOWN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH'

          Check:Result is based on check existence only.

          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]

          • epoch equals '(none)'

          V-230427 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of postdrop in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230427r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030311
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "postdrop" command creates a file in the maildrop directory and copies its standard input to the file.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful uses of the "postdrop" by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/postdrop -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:260
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030311 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of postdrop in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.
          Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "postdrop" command creates a file in the maildrop directory and copies its standard input to the file.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/postdrop)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:

          Result:false
          Title:Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/postdrop
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:26000 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/sbin/postdrop\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.

          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230428 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of postqueue in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230428r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030312
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "postqueue" command implements the Postfix user interface for queue management.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful uses of the "postqueue" by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/postqueue -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:261
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030312 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of postqueue in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Check:Result is based on check existence only.

          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/sbin/postqueue\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BROADCAST'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_RAW'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_LOCK'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_OWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RAWIO'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_CHROOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PTRACE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PACCT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_BOOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_NICE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RESOURCE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TIME'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_TTY_CONFIG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MKNOD'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LEASE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_WRITE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_CONTROL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETFCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_MAC_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYSLOG'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_WAKE_ALARM'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_BLOCK_SUSPEND'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_AUDIT_READ'
          • selinux_domain_label equals 'auditd_t'
          • session_id equals '904'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:24400 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:package audit is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:24400 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'audit'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el8'
          • version equals '3.0.7'
          • evr equals '0:3.0.7-4.el8'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230429 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of semanage in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230429r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030313
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "semanage" command is used to configure certain elements of SELinux policy without requiring modification to or recompilation from policy sources.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful uses of the "semanage" by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/semanage -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:262
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030313 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of semanage in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.
          Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "semanage" command is used to configure certain elements of SELinux policy without requiring modification to or recompilation from policy sources.

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/semanage)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check for running auditd)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (package audit is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:26200 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/semanage
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:26200 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/sbin/semanage\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:16000 (process58_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • command_line must match the pattern '^/sbin/auditd\b'
          • pid must be greater than '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • command_line equals '/sbin/auditd'
          • exec_time equals '00:00:00'
          • pid equals '904'
          • ppid equals '1'
          • priority equals '16'
          • ruid equals '0'
          • scheduling_class equals 'TS'
          • start_time equals '18:52:45'
          • tty equals '?'
          • user_id equals '0'
          • loginuid equals '4294967295'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_CHOWN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FOWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_FSETID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_KILL'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETGID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETUID'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SETPCAP'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_LINUX_IMMUTABLE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE'

          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_NET_RAW'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_LOCK'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_IPC_OWNER'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_RAWIO'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_CHROOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PTRACE'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_PACCT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_ADMIN'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_BOOT'
          • posix_capability equals 'CAP_SYS_NICE'

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.

          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'audit-(none):3.0.7-4.el8.x86_64'

          V-230430 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of setfiles in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230430r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030314
          Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
          Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "setfiles" command is primarily used to initialize the security context fields (extended attributes) on one or more filesystems (or parts of them). Usually it is initially run as part of the SELinux installation process (a step commonly known as labeling).

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any successful/unsuccessful uses of the "setfiles" by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

          -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/setfiles -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:263
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030314 - Successful/unsuccessful uses of setfiles in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.
          Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

          At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "setfiles" command is primarily used to initialize the security context fields (extended attributes) on one or more filesystems (or parts of them). Usually it is initially run as part of the SELinux installation process (a step commonly known as labeling).

          When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

              • true (check for running auditd)

                • true (package audit is installed)

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:26300 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+path=/usr/sbin/setfiles\s+(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)(\s+(-k\s+|-F\s+key=)\S+)?\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:16000 (process58_test)

          Title:check for running auditd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
