          V-230293 - RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for /var/log.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230293r902720_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010541
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing. false
          Fix Text:Migrate the "/var/log" path onto a separate file system.
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8os:def:230293
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010541 - RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for /var/log.
          Description:The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (There is a separate file system for /var/log.)
              • false (There is a separate file system configured for /var/log.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.linux:tst:23029300 (partition_test)
          Result:false
          Title:There is a separate file system for /var/log.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.linux:obj:23029300 (partition_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • mount_point must be equal to '/var/log'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • mount_point does not exist
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:tst:23029301 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:There is a separate file system configured for /var/log.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:obj:23029301 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/fstab'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[^# \t]+\s+/var/log\s+'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230294 - RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for the system audit data path.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230294r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-010542
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing. false
          Fix Text:Migrate the system audit data path onto a separate file system.
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:157
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-010542 - RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for the system audit data path.
          Description:The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (There is a separate file system for audit data directory.)
            • false (There is a separate file system configured for audit data directory.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:15700 (partition_test)
          Result:false
          Title:There is a separate file system for audit data directory.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:15700 (partition_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • for mount_point, at least one of the following must be true:
            • mount_point must be equal to '/var/log/audit'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • mount_point does not exist
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:15701 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:There is a separate file system configured for audit data directory.
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:15701 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/fstab'
          • for pattern, at least one of the following must be true:
            • pattern must match the pattern '^[^# \t]+\s+/var/log/audit\s+'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230346 - RHEL 8 must limit the number of concurrent sessions to ten for all accounts and/or account types.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230346r877399_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-020024
          Identities:CCI-000054 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-10; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-10)
          Description: Operating system management includes the ability to control the number of users and user sessions that utilize an operating system. Limiting the number of allowed users and sessions per user is helpful in reducing the risks related to DoS attacks.

          This requirement addresses concurrent sessions for information system accounts and does not address concurrent sessions by single users via multiple system accounts. The maximum number of concurrent sessions should be defined based on mission needs and the operational environment for each system. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to limit the number of concurrent sessions to "10" for all accounts and/or account types.

          Add the following line to the top of the /etc/security/limits.conf or in a ".conf" file defined in /etc/security/limits.d/:

          * hard maxlogins 10
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8os:def:230346
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-020024 - RHEL 8 must limit the number of concurrent sessions to ten for all accounts and/or account types.
          Description:Operating system management includes the ability to control the number of users and user sessions that utilize an operating system. Limiting the number of allowed users and sessions per user is helpful in reducing the risks related to DoS attacks.

          This requirement addresses concurrent sessions for information system accounts and does not address concurrent sessions by single users via multiple system accounts. The maximum number of concurrent sessions should be defined based on mission needs and the operational environment for each system.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (limits.conf and limits.d/*.conf:maxlogins is set to 10 or less by default)
              • true (limits.conf and limits.d/*.conf:maxlogins is set to 10 or less for non-default domains)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:tst:23034600 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:limits.conf and limits.d/*.conf:maxlogins is set to 10 or less by default
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:obj:23034600 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:ste:23034600 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be less than or equal to '10'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:tst:23034601 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:limits.conf and limits.d/*.conf:maxlogins is set to 10 or less for non-default domains
          Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:obj:23034603 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:ste:23034600 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be less than or equal to '10'

          V-230485 - RHEL 8 must disable the chrony daemon from acting as a server.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230485r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030741
          Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
          Description: Inaccurate time stamps make it more difficult to correlate events and can lead to an inaccurate analysis. Determining the correct time a particular event occurred on a system is critical when conducting forensic analysis and investigating system events. Sources outside the configured acceptable allowance (drift) may be inaccurate.

          Minimizing the exposure of the server functionality of the chrony daemon diminishes the attack surface.

          RHEL 8 utilizes the "timedatectl" command to view the status of the "systemd-timesyncd.service". The "timedatectl" status will display the local time, UTC, and the offset from UTC.

          Note that USNO offers authenticated NTP service to DoD and U.S. Government agencies operating on the NIPR and SIPR networks. Visit https://www.usno.navy.mil/USNO/time/ntp/dod-customers for more information. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the chrony daemon from acting as a server by adding/modifying the following line in the /etc/chrony.conf file.

          port 0
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:310
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-030741 - RHEL 8 must disable the chrony daemon from acting as a server.
          Description:Inaccurate time stamps make it more difficult to correlate events and can lead to an inaccurate analysis. Determining the correct time a particular event occurred on a system is critical when conducting forensic analysis and investigating system events. Sources outside the configured acceptable allowance (drift) may be inaccurate.

          Minimizing the exposure of the server functionality of the chrony daemon diminishes the attack surface.

          RHEL 8 utilizes the "timedatectl" command to view the status of the "systemd-timesyncd.service". The "timedatectl" status will display the local time, UTC, and the offset from UTC.

          Note that USNO offers authenticated NTP service to DoD and U.S. Government agencies operating on the NIPR and SIPR networks. Visit https://www.usno.navy.mil/USNO/time/ntp/dod-customers for more information.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/chrony.conf: port option is set to 0)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:31000 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/chrony.conf: port option is set to 0
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:31000 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/chrony.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*port[ \t]+0[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230486 - RHEL 8 must disable network management of the chrony daemon.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230486r627750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-030742
          Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
          Description: Inaccurate time stamps make it more difficult to correlate events and can lead to an inaccurate analysis. Determining the correct time a particular event occurred on a system is critical when conducting forensic analysis and investigating system events. Sources outside the configured acceptable allowance (drift) may be inaccurate.

          Not exposing the management interface of the chrony daemon on the network diminishes the attack space.

          RHEL 8 utilizes the "timedatectl" command to view the status of the "systemd-timesyncd.service". The "timedatectl" status will display the local time, UTC, and the offset from UTC.

          Note that USNO offers authenticated NTP service to DoD and U.S. Government agencies operating on the NIPR and SIPR networks. Visit https://www.usno.navy.mil/USNO/time/ntp/dod-customers for more information. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system disable network management of the chrony daemon by adding/modifying the following line in the /etc/chrony.conf file.

          cmdport 0
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921

          Description:Inaccurate time stamps make it more difficult to correlate events and can lead to an inaccurate analysis. Determining the correct time a particular event occurred on a system is critical when conducting forensic analysis and investigating system events. Sources outside the configured acceptable allowance (drift) may be inaccurate.

          Not exposing the management interface of the chrony daemon on the network diminishes the attack space.

          RHEL 8 utilizes the "timedatectl" command to view the status of the "systemd-timesyncd.service". The "timedatectl" status will display the local time, UTC, and the offset from UTC.

          Note that USNO offers authenticated NTP service to DoD and U.S. Government agencies operating on the NIPR and SIPR networks. Visit https://www.usno.navy.mil/USNO/time/ntp/dod-customers for more information.

          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*cmdport[ \t]+0[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230494 - RHEL 8 must disable the asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) protocol.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230494r792911_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-040021
          Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
          Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Failing to disconnect unused protocols can result in a system compromise.

          The Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) is a protocol operating on network, data link, and physical layers, based on virtual circuits and virtual paths. Disabling ATM protects the system against exploitation of any laws in its implementation. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the ATM protocol kernel module.

          Add or update the following lines in the file "/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf":

          install atm /bin/true
          blacklist atm

          Reboot the system for the settings to take effect.
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:318
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-040021 - RHEL 8 must disable the asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) protocol.
          Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Failing to disconnect unused protocols can result in a system compromise.

          The Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) is a protocol operating on network, data link, and physical layers, based on virtual circuits and virtual paths. Disabling ATM protects the system against exploitation of any laws in its implementation.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install atm /bin/true')
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist atm')
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:31800 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install atm /bin/true'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:31800 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*install[ \t]+atm[ \t]+/bin/true[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:31801 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist atm'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:31801 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*blacklist[ \t]+atm[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230495 - RHEL 8 must disable the controller area network (CAN) protocol.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230495r792914_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-040022
          Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
          Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Failing to disconnect unused protocols can result in a system compromise.

          The Controller Area Network (CAN) is a serial communications protocol, which was initially developed for automotive and is now also used in marine, industrial, and medical applications. Disabling CAN protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in its implementation. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the CAN protocol kernel module.

          Add or update the following lines in the file "/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf":

          install can /bin/true
          blacklist can

          Reboot the system for the settings to take effect.
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:319
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-040022 - RHEL 8 must disable the controller area network (CAN) protocol.
          Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Failing to disconnect unused protocols can result in a system compromise.

          The Controller Area Network (CAN) is a serial communications protocol, which was initially developed for automotive and is now also used in marine, industrial, and medical applications. Disabling CAN protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in its implementation.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install can /bin/true')
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist can')
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:31900 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install can /bin/true'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:31900 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*install[ \t]+can[ \t]+/bin/true[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:31901 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist can'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:31901 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*blacklist[ \t]+can[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230496 - RHEL 8 must disable the stream control transmission protocol (SCTP).

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230496r792917_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-040023
          Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
          Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Failing to disconnect unused protocols can result in a system compromise.

          The Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) is a transport layer protocol, designed to support the idea of message-oriented communication, with several streams of messages within one connection. Disabling SCTP protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in its implementation. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the SCTP kernel module.

          Add or update the following lines in the file "/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf":

          install sctp /bin/true
          blacklist sctp

          Reboot the system for the settings to take effect.
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:320
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-040023 - RHEL 8 must disable the stream control transmission (SCTP) protocol.
          Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Failing to disconnect unused protocols can result in a system compromise.

          The Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) is a transport layer protocol, designed to support the idea of message-oriented communication, with several streams of messages within one connection. Disabling SCTP protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in its implementation.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install sctp /bin/true')
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist sctp')
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32000 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install sctp /bin/true'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32000 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*install[ \t]+sctp[ \t]+/bin/true[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32001 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist sctp'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32001 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*blacklist[ \t]+sctp[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230497 - RHEL 8 must disable the transparent inter-process communication (TIPC) protocol.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230497r792920_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-040024
          Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
          Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Failing to disconnect unused protocols can result in a system compromise.

          The Transparent Inter-Process Communication (TIPC) protocol is designed to provide communications between nodes in a cluster. Disabling TIPC protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in its implementation. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the TIPC protocol kernel module.

          Add or update the following lines in the file "/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf":

          install tipc /bin/true
          blacklist tipc

          Reboot the system for the settings to take effect.
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:321
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-040024 - RHEL 8 must disable the transparent inter-process communication (TIPC) protocol.
          Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Failing to disconnect unused protocols can result in a system compromise.

          The Transparent Inter-Process Communication (TIPC) protocol is designed to provide communications between nodes in a cluster. Disabling TIPC protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in its implementation.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install tipc /bin/true')
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist tipc')
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install tipc /bin/true'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*install[ \t]+tipc[ \t]+/bin/true[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32101 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist tipc'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32101 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*blacklist[ \t]+tipc[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230498 - RHEL 8 must disable mounting of cramfs.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230498r792922_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-040025
          Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
          Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface of the server.

          Compressed ROM/RAM file system (or cramfs) is a read-only file system designed for simplicity and space-efficiency. It is mainly used in embedded and small-footprint systems. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the cramfs kernel module.

          Add or update the following lines in the file "/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf":

          install cramfs /bin/true
          blacklist cramfs

          Reboot the system for the settings to take effect.
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:322
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-040025 - RHEL 8 must disable mounting of cramfs.
          Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface of the server.

          Compressed ROM/RAM file system (or cramfs) is a read-only file system designed for simplicity and space-efficiency. It is mainly used in embedded and small-footprint systems.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install cramfs /bin/true')
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist cramfs')
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32200 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install cramfs /bin/true'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32200 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*install[ \t]+cramfs[ \t]+/bin/true[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32201 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist cramfs'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32201 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*blacklist[ \t]+cramfs[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-230499 - RHEL 8 must disable IEEE 1394 (FireWire) Support.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-230499r792924_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-08-040026
          Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
          Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          The IEEE 1394 (FireWire) is a serial bus standard for high-speed real-time communication. Disabling FireWire protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in its implementation. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the firewire-core kernel module.

          Add or update the following lines in the file "/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf":

          install firewire-core /bin/true
          blacklist firewire-core

          Reboot the system for the settings to take effect.
          Severity:low
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8
          Identifier:2921
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:def:323
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-08-040026 - RHEL 8 must disable IEEE 1394 (FireWire) Support.
          Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

          The IEEE 1394 (FireWire) is a serial bus standard for high-speed real-time communication. Disabling FireWire protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in its implementation.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install firewire-core /bin/true')
            • false (/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist firewire-core')
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32300 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'install firewire-core /bin/true'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:obj:32300 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*install[ \t]+firewire-core[ \t]+/bin/true[ \t]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel8:tst:32301 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/modprobe.d contains a file that contains 'blacklist firewire-core'
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
